Class CommandHistory

java.lang.Object
  |

              +--java.util.AbstractSequentialList
                    |
                    +--java.util.LinkedList
                          |
                          +--client.CommandHistory
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Collection, java.util.List, java.io.Serializable
public final class CommandHistory
extends java.util.LinkedList

Class to manage the history of messages/commands from the user Is in the form of a fixed length stack that drops items from the end of the stack when the maximum length is reached exends the linked list class; all items on the list are Strings

Version:
0.8
Author:
Joseph Monti countjoe@users.sourceforge.net
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Summary
 void add(java.lang.String s)
          Adds a string to the list and checks to see if the new item breached the maximum size of the list also sets the current to be -1 to reset the current position
 java.lang.String getDown()
          retrieves the next newest item from the list while stopping that the bottom and decrementing the current item
 java.lang.String getUp()
          retrives the next oldest item from the list while stopping at the top and incrementing the current item

Constructor Detail

Method Detail

add

public void add(java.lang.String s)
Adds a string to the list and checks to see if the new item breached the maximum size of the list also sets the current to be -1 to reset the current position

Parameters:
s - the string to be added

getUp

public java.lang.String getUp()
retrives the next oldest item from the list while stopping at the top and incrementing the current item

Returns:
the appropriate item from the list, or null if at top

getDown

public java.lang.String getDown()
retrieves the next newest item from the list while stopping that the bottom and decrementing the current item

Returns:
the appropriate item from the list, or null if at bottom
